column1:
What is the primary purpose of the Ear plugin in a web application project?

A. To assemble web application EAR files
B. To manage database connections
C. To optimize Java code performance
D. To create user interfaces
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of the Ear plugin is to assemble web application EAR (Enterprise Archive) files. This plugin facilitates the packaging of applications into a format that can be deployed on application servers, ensuring that all necessary components are included in the archive.

column1:
Which directory is the default source for application resources when using the Ear plugin?

A. src/main/resources
B. src/main/application
C. src/main/lib
D. src/main/webapp
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The default source directory for application resources when using the Ear plugin is `src/main/application`. This directory is where the plugin looks for files to include in the EAR archive, such as the `META-INF` directory.

column1:
What happens if a deployment descriptor file does not exist in the application directory when using the Ear plugin?

A. The build will fail.
B. A default deployment descriptor will be generated.
C. The application will not be packaged.
D. The application will be packaged without any configuration.
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If a deployment descriptor file does not exist in the application directory when using the Ear plugin, a default deployment descriptor will be generated. This ensures that the application can still be packaged correctly, even if the user has not provided a custom descriptor.

column1:
What are the two dependency configurations added by the Ear plugin?

A. compile and runtime
B. deploy and earlib
C. test and integration
D. main and optional
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The Ear plugin adds two dependency configurations: `deploy` and `earlib`. Dependencies in the `deploy` configuration are placed in the root of the EAR archive and are not transitive, while those in the `earlib` configuration are placed in the 'lib' directory and are transitive, meaning they can be used by other components of the application.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of Gradle plugins?

A. To enhance the functionality of the Gradle build system
B. To create standalone applications without a build system
C. To manage database connections in applications
D. To compile source code into machine language
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of Gradle plugins is to enhance the functionality of the Gradle build system by adding new tasks, configurations, and capabilities that facilitate the building, testing, and deployment of applications. Plugins allow developers to customize their build processes according to their specific needs.

column1:
Which of the following is a common feature of Gradle plugins?

A. They can only be used with Java projects
B. They can define custom tasks and configurations
C. They automatically generate source code
D. They are limited to managing dependencies only
column2:
Correct Answer: B

A common feature of Gradle plugins is their ability to define custom tasks and configurations. This allows developers to tailor the build process to their specific requirements, enabling a wide range of functionalities beyond just dependency management.

column1:
What is the role of the 'Ear' plugin in Gradle?

A. To compile Java source code into bytecode
B. To assemble web application EAR files
C. To manage database migrations
D. To optimize application performance
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'Ear' plugin in Gradle is specifically designed to assemble web application EAR (Enterprise Archive) files. It provides tasks and configurations that facilitate the packaging of applications for deployment in Java EE environments, ensuring that all necessary resources are included in the final archive.

column1:
What does the 'deploy' configuration in the Ear plugin do?

A. It includes transitive dependencies in the EAR file
B. It places dependencies in the root of the EAR archive without transitivity
C. It generates the application.xml deployment descriptor
D. It compiles the application source code
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'deploy' configuration in the Ear plugin is used to place dependencies in the root of the EAR archive without transitive dependencies. This means that only the specified dependencies are included, and any dependencies of those dependencies are not automatically added to the archive.

column1:
What is the purpose of the 'deploy' configuration in the Ear plugin's dependency management?

A. To include transitive dependencies in the EAR archive
B. To place dependencies in the root of the EAR archive without transitivity
C. To manage dependencies for the build process only
D. To specify the version of the application
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'deploy' configuration in the Ear plugin's dependency management is specifically designed to place dependencies in the root of the EAR archive without transitive dependencies. This means that only the specified dependencies will be included, and their dependencies will not be automatically included in the archive.

column1:
How does the 'earlib' configuration differ from the 'deploy' configuration?

A. It includes only non-transitive dependencies.
B. It places dependencies in the 'lib' directory and includes transitive dependencies.
C. It is used for managing build scripts only.
D. It is not used in the Ear plugin.
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'earlib' configuration is designed to place dependencies in the 'lib' directory of the EAR archive and includes transitive dependencies. This means that not only the specified dependencies are included, but also any dependencies that those specified dependencies rely on will be included in the archive.

column1:
What happens if a deployment descriptor file already exists in the specified directory?

A. The existing file will be deleted.
B. The existing file will be ignored, and a new one will be generated.
C. The existing file contents will be used, and explicit configuration will be ignored.
D. The build will fail due to a conflict.
column2:
Correct Answer: C

If a deployment descriptor file already exists in the specified directory (e.g., `META-INF/application.xml`), the existing file contents will be used, and any explicit configuration in the build script regarding the deployment descriptor will be ignored. This allows for custom configurations to take precedence over defaults.

column1:
What is the default directory structure for application resources in a project using the Ear plugin?

A. src/main/resources
B. src/main/application
C. src/main/lib
D. src/main/ear
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The default directory structure for application resources in a project using the Ear plugin is 'src/main/application'. This is where the application source files, including the META-INF directory, are expected to be located.

column1:
What is the purpose of the 'META-INF' directory in the project layout for an EAR file?

A. To store application source code
B. To contain configuration files and deployment descriptors
C. To hold library dependencies
D. To keep temporary files during the build process
column2:
Correct Answer: B

The 'META-INF' directory in the project layout for an EAR file is used to contain configuration files and deployment descriptors, such as 'application.xml'. This directory is essential for defining how the application should be deployed and configured.

column1:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the project layout when using the Ear plugin?

A. The project layout must include a 'src/main/ear' directory.
B. The 'src/main/application' directory is optional.
C. The default behavior is to copy content from 'src/main/application' to the root of the EAR archive.
D. The 'META-INF' directory is not required for EAR files.
column2:
Correct Answer: C

The default behavior of the Ear plugin is to copy the content of 'src/main/application' to the root of the EAR archive. This ensures that the necessary application resources are included in the final EAR file.

column1:
What is the primary purpose of customizing build scripts in the context of the Ear plugin?

A. To change the default behavior of the Ear task and tailor it to specific project needs
B. To eliminate the need for any configuration in the build process
C. To ensure that all dependencies are automatically included without any manual specification
D. To create a new version of the Ear plugin with additional features
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The primary purpose of customizing build scripts when using the Ear plugin is to change the default behavior of the Ear task, allowing developers to tailor the build process to meet specific project requirements. Customization can include specifying different directories for application resources or modifying how dependencies are managed.

column1:
Which of the following is a common customization option available in the Ear plugin?

A. Changing the programming language of the project
B. Specifying the source directory for application resources
C. Automatically generating test cases for the application
D. Creating a new build tool
column2:
Correct Answer: B

A common customization option in the Ear plugin is specifying the source directory for application resources, which can be done using the `appDirName` property. This allows developers to define where the application files are located, ensuring that the build process correctly assembles the EAR file.

column1:
What happens if a custom deployment descriptor file is not provided in the Ear plugin?

A. The build process will fail due to missing configuration
B. A default deployment descriptor will be generated automatically
C. The application will not be packaged into an EAR file
D. The plugin will skip the assembly of the application entirely
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If a custom deployment descriptor file is not provided when using the Ear plugin, a default deployment descriptor will be generated automatically. This ensures that the application can still be packaged correctly into an EAR file, even if specific configurations are not explicitly defined.

column1:
What is the purpose of convention properties in the context of the Ear plugin?

A. To define default values for various configurations related to the EAR file
B. To specify the runtime environment for the application
C. To manage the versioning of the application dependencies
D. To enforce coding standards within the project
column2:
Correct Answer: A

Convention properties in the Ear plugin are used to define default values for various configurations related to the EAR file. These properties help streamline the setup process by providing sensible defaults, which can be overridden if necessary, allowing for easier customization of the build process.

column1:
Which of the following is a default convention property for the Ear plugin?

A. appDirName
B. sourceCompatibility
C. mainClassName
D. testFramework
column2:
Correct Answer: A

The 'appDirName' is a default convention property for the Ear plugin, specifying the name of the application source directory relative to the project directory. This property helps in organizing the project structure and is set to 'src/main/application' by default.

column1:
What happens if a custom deployment descriptor file is not provided in the Ear plugin?

A. The build will fail due to missing configuration
B. A default deployment descriptor will be generated automatically
C. The application will not be packaged into an EAR file
D. The application will be packaged without any metadata
column2:
Correct Answer: B

If a custom deployment descriptor file is not provided, the Ear plugin will automatically generate a default deployment descriptor. This ensures that the application can still be packaged correctly into an EAR file, even if specific configurations are not explicitly defined.

column1:
How can users customize the default values of convention properties in the Ear plugin?

A. By modifying the build script directly for each task
B. By using the convention properties only
C. By creating a separate configuration file
D. By using the 'ear' command line option
column2:
Correct Answer: A

Users can customize the default values of convention properties in the Ear plugin by modifying the build script directly for each task. This allows for specific configurations to be set according to the project's requirements, rather than relying solely on the default values.
